title.text: RFC 3394:  Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap Algorithm

contents.text:
Network Working Group                                          J. Schaad
Request for Comments: 3394                       Soaring Hawk Consulting
Category: Informational                                       R. Housley
                                                        RSA Laboratories
                                                          September 2002
Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap Algorithm
contents.zh-CHS: 高级加密标准（AES）密钥包裹算法

contents.text: This memo provides information for the Internet community. It does not specify an Internet standard of any kind. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录为互联网社区提供信息。它没有规定任何类型的互联网标准。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: Copyright (C) The Internet Society (2002). All Rights Reserved.
contents.zh-CHS: 版权所有（C）互联网协会（2002年）。版权所有。

contents.text: The purpose of this document is to make the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm conveniently available to the Internet community. The United States of America has adopted AES as the new encryption standard. The AES Key Wrap algorithm will probably be adopted by the USA for encryption of AES keys. The authors took most of the text in this document from the draft AES Key Wrap posted by NIST.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档的目的是使高级加密标准（AES）密钥封装算法方便地提供给互联网社区。美国已采用AES作为新的加密标准。美国可能会采用AES密钥包裹算法对AES密钥进行加密。作者从NIST发布的AES密钥封装草案中获取了本文件中的大部分文本。

contents.text: NOTE: Most of the following text is taken from [AES-WRAP], and the assertions regarding the security of the AES Key Wrap algorithm are made by the US Government, not by the authors of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：以下大部分文本摘自[AES-WRAP]，关于AES密钥包裹算法安全性的断言由美国政府提出，而非本文件作者。

contents.text: This specification is intended to satisfy the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Key Wrap requirement to: Design a cryptographic algorithm called a Key Wrap that uses the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) as a primitive to securely encrypt plaintext key(s) with any associated integrity information and data, such that the combination could be longer than the width of the AES block size (128-bits). Each ciphertext bit should be a highly non-linear function of each plaintext bit, and (when unwrapping) each plaintext bit should be a highly non-linear function of each ciphertext bit. It is sufficient to approximate an ideal pseudorandom permutation to the degree that exploitation of undesirable phenomena is as unlikely as guessing the AES engine key.
contents.zh-CHS: 本规范旨在满足美国国家标准与技术研究所（NIST）密钥封装要求：设计一种称为密钥封装的加密算法，该算法使用高级加密标准（AES）作为原语，以安全地加密具有任何相关完整性信息和数据的明文密钥，这样，组合可以比AES块大小的宽度（128位）长。每个密文位应该是每个明文位的高度非线性函数，并且（在展开时）每个明文位应该是每个密文位的高度非线性函数。将理想伪随机置换近似到利用不良现象与猜测AES引擎密钥一样不可能的程度就足够了。

contents.text: This key wrap algorithm needs to provide ample security to protect keys in the context of prudently designed key management architecture.
contents.zh-CHS: 这种密钥封装算法需要提供足够的安全性，以便在精心设计的密钥管理体系结构中保护密钥。

contents.text: Throughout this document, any data being wrapped will be referred to as the key data. It makes no difference to the algorithm whether the data being wrapped is a key; in fact there is often good reason to include other data with the key, to wrap multiple keys together, or to wrap data that isn't strictly a key. So, the term "key data" is used broadly to mean any data being wrapped, but particularly keys, since this is primarily a key wrap algorithm. The key used to do the wrapping will be referred to as the key-encryption key (KEK).
contents.zh-CHS: 在本文档中，任何被包装的数据都将被称为关键数据。被包装的数据是否是密钥对算法没有影响；事实上，通常有很好的理由将其他数据包含在密钥中，将多个密钥包装在一起，或者包装严格意义上不是密钥的数据。因此，术语“密钥数据”被广泛用于表示任何被包装的数据，尤其是密钥，因为这主要是一种密钥包装算法。用于包装的密钥称为密钥加密密钥（KEK）。

contents.text: In this document a KEK can be any valid key supported by the AES codebook. That is, a KEK can be a 128-bit key, a 192-bit key, or a 256-bit key.
contents.zh-CHS: 在本文档中，KEK可以是AES码本支持的任何有效密钥。也就是说，KEK可以是128位密钥、192位密钥或256位密钥。

contents.text: The AES key wrap algorithm is designed to wrap or encrypt key data. The key wrap operates on blocks of 64 bits. Before being wrapped, the key data is parsed into n blocks of 64 bits.
contents.zh-CHS: AES密钥封装算法设计用于封装或加密密钥数据。密钥换行对64位的块进行操作。在包装之前，密钥数据被解析为64位的n个块。

contents.text: The only restriction the key wrap algorithm places on n is that n be at least two. (For key data with length less than or equal to 64 bits, the constant field used in this specification and the key data form a single 128-bit codebook input making this key wrap unnecessary.) The key wrap algorithm accommodates all supported AES key sizes. However, other cryptographic values often need to be wrapped. One such value is the seed of the random number generator for DSS. This seed value requires n to be greater than four. Undoubtedly other values require this type of protection. Therefore, no upper bound is imposed on n.
contents.zh-CHS: 密钥包裹算法对n的唯一限制是n至少为2。（对于长度小于或等于64位的密钥数据，本规范中使用的常量字段和密钥数据形成单个128位码本输入，因此不需要此密钥换行。）密钥换行算法适应所有支持的AES密钥大小。但是，通常需要包装其他加密值。其中一个值是DSS随机数生成器的种子。此种子值要求n大于4。毫无疑问，其他价值观需要这种保护。因此，n没有上界。

contents.text: The AES key wrap can be configured to use any of the three key sizes supported by the AES codebook. The choice of a key size affects the overall security provided by the key wrap, but it does not alter the description of the key wrap algorithm. Therefore, in the description that follows, the key wrap is described generically; no key size is specified for the KEK.
contents.zh-CHS: AES密钥包装可以配置为使用AES码本支持的三种密钥大小中的任意一种。密钥大小的选择会影响密钥封装提供的总体安全性，但不会改变密钥封装算法的描述。因此，在下面的描述中，一般地描述密钥包装；没有为KEK指定密钥大小。

contents.text: The following notation is used in the description of the key wrapping algorithms:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下符号用于密钥包装算法的描述：

contents.text: AES(K, W) Encrypt W using the AES codebook with key K AES-1(K, W) Decrypt W using the AES codebook with key K MSB(j, W) Return the most significant j bits of W LSB(j, W) Return the least significant j bits of W B1 ^ B2 The bitwise exclusive or (XOR) of B1 and B2 B1 | B2 Concatenate B1 and B2 K The key-encryption key K n The number of 64-bit key data blocks s The number of steps in the wrapping process, s = 6n P[i] The ith plaintext key data block C[i] The ith ciphertext data block A The 64-bit integrity check register R[i] An array of 64-bit registers where i = 0, 1, 2, ..., n A[t], R[i][t] The contents of registers A and R[i] after encryption step t. IV The 64-bit initial value used during the wrapping process.
contents.zh-CHS: AES（K，W）使用密钥为K的AES码本加密W AES-1（K，W）使用密钥为K的AES码本解密W MSB（j，W）返回W的最高有效j位LSB（j，W）返回W B1^B2的最低有效j位按位异或（XOR）B1和B2的B1 | B2连接B1和b2k密钥加密密钥kn 64位密钥数据块的数量s包装过程中的步骤数，s=6np[i]第i个明文密钥数据块C[i]第i个密文数据块A 64位完整性检查寄存器R[i]一个64位寄存器数组，其中i=0，1，2，…，na[t]，R[i][t]在加密步骤t之后，寄存器A和R[i]的内容。IV包装过程中使用的64位初始值。

contents.text: In the key wrap algorithm, the concatenation function will be used to concatenate 64-bit quantities to form the 128-bit input to the AES codebook. The extraction functions will be used to split the 128-bit output from the AES codebook into two 64-bit quantities.
contents.zh-CHS: 在密钥包裹算法中，串联函数将用于串联64位量，以形成AES码本的128位输入。提取函数将用于将AES码本的128位输出拆分为两个64位量。

contents.text: The specification of the key wrap algorithm requires the use of the AES codebook [AES]. The next three sections will describe the key wrap algorithm, the key unwrap algorithm, and the inherent data integrity check.
contents.zh-CHS: 密钥包裹算法的规范要求使用AES码本[AES]。接下来的三个部分将描述密钥包裹算法、密钥展开算法和固有的数据完整性检查。

contents.text: The inputs to the key wrapping process are the KEK and the plaintext to be wrapped. The plaintext consists of n 64-bit blocks, containing the key data being wrapped. The key wrapping process is described below.
contents.zh-CHS: 密钥包装过程的输入是KEK和要包装的明文。明文由n个64位块组成，其中包含要包装的密钥数据。密钥包装过程如下所述。

contents.text: Inputs: Plaintext, n 64-bit values {P1, P2, ..., Pn}, and Key, K (the KEK). Outputs: Ciphertext, (n+1) 64-bit values {C0, C1, ..., Cn}.
contents.zh-CHS: 输入：明文，n个64位值{P1，P2，…，Pn}，键，K（KEK）。输出：密文，（n+1）64位值{C0，C1，…，Cn}。

contents.text: Set A0 to an initial value (see 2.2.3) For i = 1 to n R[0][i] = P[i]
contents.zh-CHS: 对于i=1到nR[0][i]=P[i]，将A0设置为初始值（见2.2.3）

contents.text:
For t = 1 to s, where s = 6n
    A[t] = MSB(64, AES(K, A[t-1] | R[t-1][1])) ^ t
    For i = 1 to n-1
        R[t][i] = R[t-1][i+1]
    R[t][n] = LSB(64, AES(K, A[t-1] | R[t-1][1]))
Set C[0] = A[t] For i = 1 to n C[i] = R[t][i]

An alternative description of the key wrap algorithm involves indexing rather than shifting. This approach allows one to calculate the wrapped key in place, avoiding the rotation in the previous description. This produces identical results and is more easily implemented in software.
contents.zh-CHS: 密钥换行算法的另一种描述涉及索引而不是移位。这种方法允许计算在位的包裹关键点，避免前面描述中的旋转。这会产生相同的结果，并且更容易在软件中实现。

contents.text: Inputs: Plaintext, n 64-bit values {P1, P2, ..., Pn}, and Key, K (the KEK). Outputs: Ciphertext, (n+1) 64-bit values {C0, C1, ..., Cn}.
contents.zh-CHS: 输入：明文，n个64位值{P1，P2，…，Pn}，键，K（KEK）。输出：密文，（n+1）64位值{C0，C1，…，Cn}。

contents.text: Set A = IV, an initial value (see 2.2.3) For i = 1 to n R[i] = P[i]
contents.zh-CHS: 设置A=IV，i=1到n R[i]=P[i]的初始值（见2.2.3）

contents.text:
For j = 0 to 5
    For i=1 to n
        B = AES(K, A | R[i])
        A = MSB(64, B) ^ t where t = (n*j)+i
        R[i] = LSB(64, B)
Set C[0] = A For i = 1 to n C[i] = R[i]

The inputs to the unwrap process are the KEK and (n+1) 64-bit blocks of ciphertext consisting of previously wrapped key. It returns n blocks of plaintext consisting of the n 64-bit blocks of the decrypted key data.
contents.zh-CHS: 解包裹过程的输入是KEK和（n+1）64位密文块，由先前包装的密钥组成。它返回由n个64位解密密钥数据块组成的n个明文块。

contents.text: Inputs: Ciphertext, (n+1) 64-bit values {C0, C1, ..., Cn}, and Key, K (the KEK). Outputs: Plaintext, n 64-bit values {P1, P2, ..., Pn}.
contents.zh-CHS: 输入：密文，（n+1）64位值{C0，C1，…，Cn}，和密钥K（KEK）。输出：明文，n个64位值{P1，P2，…，Pn}。

contents.text: Set A[s] = C[0] where s = 6n For i = 1 to n R[s][i] = C[i]

For t = s to 1
    A[t-1] = MSB(64, AES-1(K, ((A[t] ^ t) | R[t][n]))
    R[t-1][1] = LSB(64, AES-1(K, ((A[t]^t) | R[t][n]))
    For i = 2 to n
        R[t-1][i] = R[t][i-1]
If A[0] is an appropriate initial value (see 2.2.3), Then For i = 1 to n P[i] = R[0][i] Else Return an error
contents.zh-CHS: 如果[0]是适当的初始值（见2.2.3），则对于i=1到n P[i]=R[0][i]，否则返回一个错误

contents.text: The unwrap algorithm can also be specified as an index based operation, allowing the calculations to be carried out in place. Again, this produces the same results as the register shifting approach.
contents.zh-CHS: 展开算法也可以指定为基于索引的操作，允许就地执行计算。同样，这会产生与寄存器移位方法相同的结果。

contents.text: Inputs: Ciphertext, (n+1) 64-bit values {C0, C1, ..., Cn}, and Key, K (the KEK). Outputs: Plaintext, n 64-bit values {P0, P1, K, Pn}.
contents.zh-CHS: 输入：密文，（n+1）64位值{C0，C1，…，Cn}，和密钥K（KEK）。输出：明文，n个64位值{P0，P1，K，Pn}。

contents.text: Set A = C[0] For i = 1 to n R[i] = C[i]

For j = 5 to 0
    For i = n to 1
        B = AES-1(K, (A ^ t) | R[i]) where t = n*j+i
        A = MSB(64, B)
        R[i] = LSB(64, B)
If A is an appropriate initial value (see 2.2.3), Then For i = 1 to n P[i] = R[i] Else Return an error
contents.zh-CHS: 如果A是适当的初始值（见2.2.3），则对于i=1到n P[i]=R[i]，否则返回一个错误

contents.text: 2.2.3 Key Data Integrity -- the Initial Value
contents.zh-CHS: 2.2.3 关键数据完整性——初始值

contents.text: The initial value (IV) refers to the value assigned to A[0] in the first step of the wrapping process. This value is used to obtain an integrity check on the key data. In the final step of the unwrapping process, the recovered value of A[0] is compared to the expected
contents.zh-CHS: 初始值（IV）是指在包装过程的第一步中分配给[0]的值。此值用于获取密钥数据的完整性检查。在展开过程的最后一步，将[0]的恢复值与预期值进行比较

contents.text: value of A[0]. If there is a match, the key is accepted as valid, and the unwrapping algorithm returns it. If there is not a match, then the key is rejected, and the unwrapping algorithm returns an error.
contents.zh-CHS: A[0]的值。如果存在匹配项，则密钥被视为有效密钥，展开算法将返回该密钥。如果不存在匹配项，则拒绝密钥，并且展开算法返回错误。

contents.text: The exact properties achieved by this integrity check depend on the definition of the initial value. Different applications may call for somewhat different properties; for example, whether there is need to determine the integrity of key data throughout its lifecycle or just when it is unwrapped. This specification defines a default initial value that supports integrity of the key data during the period it is wrapped (2.2.3.1). Provision is also made to support alternative initial values (in 2.2.3.2).
contents.zh-CHS: 此完整性检查实现的确切属性取决于初始值的定义。不同的应用可能需要一些不同的属性；例如，是否需要确定关键数据在其整个生命周期中的完整性，还是仅在其展开时确定其完整性。本规范定义了一个默认初始值，该值支持密钥数据在包装期间的完整性（2.2.3.1）。还提供了支持备选初始值的规定（见2.2.3.2）。

contents.text: The default initial value (IV) is defined to be the hexadecimal constant:
contents.zh-CHS: 默认初始值（IV）定义为十六进制常数：

contents.text: The use of a constant as the IV supports a strong integrity check on the key data during the period that it is wrapped. If unwrapping produces A[0] = A6A6A6A6A6A6A6A6, then the chance that the key data is corrupt is 2^-64. If unwrapping produces A[0] any other value, then the unwrap must return an error and not return any key data.
contents.zh-CHS: 将常量用作IV支持在关键数据包装期间对其进行强完整性检查。如果展开生成[0]=A6，则密钥数据损坏的可能性为2^-64。如果展开生成[0]或任何其他值，则展开必须返回错误，而不返回任何关键数据。

contents.text: When the key wrap is used as part of a larger key management protocol or system, the desired scope for data integrity may be more than just the key data or the desired duration for more than just the period that it is wrapped. Also, if the key data is not just an AES key, it may not always be a multiple of 64 bits. Alternative definitions of the initial value can be used to address such problems. NIST will define alternative initial values in future key management publications as needed. In order to accommodate a set of alternatives that may evolve over time, key wrap implementations that are not application-specific will require some flexibility in the way that the initial value is set and tested.
contents.zh-CHS: 当密钥包装被用作更大密钥管理协议或系统的一部分时，所需的数据完整性范围可能不仅仅是密钥数据或所需的持续时间，而不仅仅是其包装的期间。此外，如果密钥数据不仅仅是AES密钥，它可能并不总是64位的倍数。初始值的替代定义可用于解决此类问题。NIST将根据需要在未来的关键管理出版物中定义替代初始值。为了适应一组可能随时间发展的备选方案，非特定于应用程序的密钥封装实现需要在初始值的设置和测试方式上具有一定的灵活性。

contents.text: NIST has assigned the following object identifiers to identify the key wrap algorithm with the default initial value specified in 2.2.3.1. One object identifier is assigned for use with each of the KEK AES key sizes.
contents.zh-CHS: NIST已分配以下对象标识符，以使用2.2.3.1中规定的默认初始值识别密钥包裹算法。为每个KEK AES密钥大小分配一个对象标识符。

contents.text: The examples in this section were generated using the index-based implementation of the key wrap algorithm. The use of this approach allows a straightforward software implementation of the key wrap algorithm.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节中的示例是使用基于索引的密钥包裹算法实现生成的。这种方法的使用允许密钥包裹算法的简单软件实现。

contents.text: 4.1 Wrap 128 bits of Key Data with a 128-bit KEK
contents.zh-CHS: 4.1 使用128位KEK包装128位密钥数据

contents.text: 1 In A6A6A6A6A6A6A6A6 0011223344556677 8899AABBCCDDEEFF Enc F4740052E82A2251 74CE86FBD7B805E7 8899AABBCCDDEEFF XorT F4740052E82A2250 74CE86FBD7B805E7 8899AABBCCDDEEFF
2 In F4740052E82A2250 74CE86FBD7B805E7 8899AABBCCDDEEFF Enc 06BA4EBDE7768D0B 74CE86FBD7B805E7 D132EE38147E76F8 XorT 06BA4EBDE7768D09 74CE86FBD7B805E7 D132EE38147E76F8

The key wrap algorithm includes a strong integrity check on the key data. If unwrapping produces the expected check value in A[0], then the chance that the key data is corrupt is 2^-64. If unwrapping produces an unexpected value, then the algorithm implementation MUST return an error, and it MUST NOT return any key data.
contents.zh-CHS: 密钥包裹算法包括对密钥数据的强完整性检查。如果展开生成[0]中的预期检查值，则密钥数据损坏的可能性为2^-64。如果展开生成意外值，则算法实现必须返回错误，并且不能返回任何关键数据。

contents.text: Implementations must protect the KEK from disclosure. Compromise of the KEK may result in the disclosure of all key data protected with that KEK.
contents.zh-CHS: 实现必须保护KEK不被泄露。泄露KEK可能会导致泄露所有受该KEK保护的关键数据。
